Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of head, possibly a gorgon coffin-fitting. Mould-made and solid. Dark grey over fired Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. Identical, but unprovenanced (Lower Egyptian), examples from the same mould are now in Dresden (Fischer 1994, 442, no.1224) and Brooklyn Museum (Perdrizet 1921, pl. 61 no. 276, TC 106) and are dated to the 3rd century AD. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen. Perdrizet, P. 1921, Les Terres cuites grecques d’Égypte de la collection Fouquet, Nancy.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DE.090) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 96, nos 312-315)
